intro: Vicia smyrnaea, commonly known as the Smyrna vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pale purple or white. Its seed pods are slender and contain several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Vicia smyrnaea is native to the Mediterranean region and is often found in rocky or dry soils.
